US House Republicans forge ahead with TikTok bill despite TrumpRepublicans in the U.S. House of Representatives vowed on Tuesday to forge ahead with a vote to ban the popular TikTok social media app, despite the concerns of Donald Trump, who holds great influence over their slim House majority. Tue, 12 Mar 2024 20:50:35 GMT TCDGQPGZNRM7PBCNKDT2O22FPU https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-house-republicans-forge-ahead-with-tiktok-bill-despite-trump-2024-03-12/David Morgan世界美国
Tesla official talks up Southeast Asia expansion as China's BYD pulls aheadTesla's expansion into Southeast Asia is a priority, a senior executive said on Tuesday, highlighting the fast-growing market where the U.S. electric-vehicle maker faces competition from China's BYD. US spy chief "cannot rule out" that China would use TikTok to influence US electionsChina could use social media app TikTok to influence the 2024 U.S. elections, U.S. Director of National Intelligence Avril Haines told a House of Representatives intelligence committee hearing on Tuesday. Saying 'China is watching,' US spy chiefs plead for Ukraine aidLeaders of U.S. intelligence agencies urgently pressed members of the House of Representatives on Tuesday to approve additional military assistance for Ukraine, saying it would not only boost Kyiv as it fights Russia but discourage Chinese aggression. Nissan, Honda consider China output cuts, Nikkei reportsJapan's Nissan Motor and Honda Motor are considering cutting production in China as they face stiff competition from BYD and other electric vehicle makers, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Tuesday. Porsche sticks to 'value over volume' strategy in weakening China marketPorsche will not take part in a fierce discount battle in the weakened Chinese market, and is instead sticking to its principle of maintaining premium prices even if it costs the luxury carmaker market share. Intel survived bid to halt millions in sales to China's Huawei, sources sayIntel has survived an effort to halt hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of chip sales to Huawei, two people familiar with the matter said, giving one of the world's largest chipmakers more time to sell to the heavily sanctioned Chinese telecoms company. Taiwan's vice president-elect on 'personal trip' to US; China objectsTaiwan's vice president-elect and former de facto ambassador to Washington, Hsiao Bi-khim, is in the United States this week for a private visit, a senior Taiwanese official and a U.S. spokesperson said on Tuesday, a trip China said it "firmly opposes."
